title: Skyfall 2014 Pinot Gris (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: Reduced aromas provide significant distraction at the outset, with floral and tropical notes fighting to get to the surface. The palate doesn't entirely stay together, as if the wine can't make up its mind which way it wants to go. White grapefruit flavors come through on the finish.

title: Telaya 2013 Turas Red
description: This wine is a unique blend of Syrah (55%), Petit Verdot (a whopping 27%) and Malbec. Aromas of firepit, woodspice, dried herbs, lemon and barnyard are followed by surprisingly elegant fruit flavors, with Petit Verdot's often burly tannins nowhere to be found.

title: Single Wheel 2013 Third Spoke Patrician Verona Vineyard Riesling (Finger Lakes)
description: Quite distinct from its Single Wheel companion bottlings, there's a rustic, slightly savory tone to pressed apple and pear flavors in this off-dry Riesling. It's light bodied and spry with a brisk, lemony finish.

title: Sivas-Sonoma 2013 Old Vine Zinfandel (Sonoma County)
description: Blended with 12% Petite Sirah, this is a hearty, ripe and stewy wine, baked in plum and blackberry. A puckering girth of tannin unwraps itself in the glass as it goes. Cinnamon and black pepper play on the finish, along with a hint of dried herb.

title: Domaine Pascal Bouchard 2014 La Classique  (Chablis)
description: Soft, crisp and fresh, this light wine has some tangy fruit as well as bright citrus. A slight texture and attractive final acidity are enhanced at the end by a juicy apple character. Drink now.

title: Domaine Sautereau 2014 Côte de Reigny Rosé (Sancerre)
description: This is a crisp, fruity and well-balanced wine. Along with its red-currant fruit and bright acidity, it has a touch of caramel that adds richness. The wine is ready to drink.

title: Thibault 2014 Fernand & Sons Sauvignon Blanc (Coteaux du Giennois)
description: The flint soil of the vineyard shows in the steely, mineral character of this wine. It is all about structure at this stage, subduing the citrus fruits that are developing. It will fill out over the next few months, so drink from late 2016.

title: Tinhorn Creek 2012 Oldfield Series Merlot (Okanagan Valley)
description: Though it's designated as reserve-level, and lists rather high alcohol, this seems thin, stemmy and green. The fruit is nearly invisible. The addition of 14% Cabernet Franc has not had any noticeable impact. Drink up.

title: Tinhorn Creek 2013 Pinot Noir (Okanagan Valley)
description: Tannic and earthy, this is defined principally by flavors of stem and bark, with thin red fruits in the background. It might best accompany a rich, oily fish such as salmon.

title: Tussock Jumper 2013 Moscato Rosé (Valencia)
description: While this foamy rosé is not elevated, it should appeal to those who like sweet Moscato bubblies. Candied flavors of raspberry, lychee and dried mango finish with a note of pineapple syrup.

title: V. Sattui 2012 Preston Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Tar and black fruit emerge from the shadows of big tannins that pucker on the palate, begging for more time to soften. Robust and full bodied with a warm ripeness, it finishes flat.

title: Eric Cottat 2014 La Vallée des Vignes  (Sancerre)
description: This wine is ripe, jammy and full of juicy red fruits supported by tannins. The wine is still young, with its bright fruit very much to the fore. Let it round out before drinking, so wait until 2018.

title: Feliz Noche 2013 Sauvignon Blanc (Santa Barbara County)
description: Aromas of clay, lime zest and faint white flowers show on the very reserved and restrained nose. The palate is also shy, with light pear juice, slightly sour lemon curd and a slight gravel component.

title: Firestone 2012 The Chairman Series Merlot (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: There's not much overt fruit on the nose of this wine, which instead shows plenty of papilla chile and bell-pepper elements. The body is light and peppery, proving easy to sip with red fruit and peppercorns, leading into a vanilla-kissed finish.

title: Austerity 2013 Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)
description: Gravel and red fruit show on the nose of this widely available wine. The body is thinner than some contemporaries, but offers brown spice and dark-red plum fruit. The tannins are quite sticky.

title: Bella Luna 2013 Estate Sangiovese (Templeton Gap District)
description: Restrained notes of pressed blueberry, condensed rose petals, rose hips and a touch of asphalt show on this delicate though rustic take on the grape. The palate shows a hint of tar but is driven by bright red fruit, proving light and easy to drink.

title: Domaine de Champarlan 2014  Menetou-Salon
description: This wine offers gentle apple and pear flavors. It is lightly textured, keeping fresh acidity and a herbal touch. Bright with clean fruitiness, it's ready to drink now.

title: Domaine de la Villaudière 2014 Tradition  (Sancerre)
description: Produced by a member of the Reverdy family, a big name in Sancerre, this is a fresh and crisply citric wine. Full of apple and tangy orange flavors, it is ready to drink.

title: Cellers Grifoll Declara 2013 Predicat Red (Priorat)
description: An earthy, raisiny opening comes around a bit but never suggests freshness. Similarly, this feels blocky, chunky and tannic. Baked flavors of raisin and plum conclude with sticky tannins and grab.

title: Coto de Hayas 2014 Garnacha-Syrah (Campo de Borja)
description: Common cherry and berry aromas lead to a fruit-punch palate with some stickiness. This tastes ripe, with nothing distinguished beyond basic berry flavors. Sweet plum and berry notes steer the finish.

title: Larchago 2014 Val de Oron  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Wiry, withdrawn plum aromas are a touch floral. A jagged palate feel with high acidity and hard tannins frames plum flavors. This is bullish overall and a bit fiery and hot on the finish.

title: Bonacchi 2010 Casalino  (Brunello di Montalcino)
description: This opens with funky aromas of barnyard, scorched earth and a whiff of decaying flower. The short, bitter palate is already evolved, offering raisin, game and a hint of cured meat alongside worn, fleeting tannins.

title: Domaine Pierre Duret 2014  Sancerre
description: This is a fresh, herbaceous wine, with green fruits, citrus and tangy, zesty acidity. A young, juicy character contrasts with a more textured aftertaste. Drink now.

title: Domaine Roger Champault 2014 Les Pierris Rosé (Sancerre)
description: A caramel aroma sets the scene for a ripe, smooth wine. It has ripe red fruits that have a nutty, toasty character that balances with the crisp acidity and tight texture. Drink now.

title: El Grifo 2014 Malvasia (Lanzarote)
description: Briny tropical-fruit aromas suggest pickles and cactus. This is chunky in build, with citrusy acidity. Briny citrus flavors cannot be further defined, while citric acidity keeps this fresh through the finish.

title: Louis Chevallier 2014  Mâcon-Villages
description: This wine is soft, simple, fruity and ready to drink. It has apple and apricot tones and light acidity to keep it fresh, with a bright and refreshing aftertaste.

title: Joseph Mellot 2014 Les Milets Rosé (Reuilly)
description: A fresh, pale rosé from Pinot Noir, this has acidity coming from the red-currant fruits and crisp raspberries. With its light texture and total fruitiness, it's a wine to drink now.

title: Joseph Mellot 2014 Les Thureaux  (Menetou-Salon)
description: From chalk soil, this wine is textured with tight tannins lying over the red cherry and berry fruits. Not rich, it's more a gentle excursion into Pinot Noir giving freshness as well as that light structure. It offers perfumed acidity at the end.

title: Grgich Hills 2012 Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: From the producer's Yountville vineyard, as well as sites in Rutherford and Calistoga, this Cab-based blend is grippy and herbal, rustic in baked bread, cassis and cedar. Full bodied, it finishes in thick, leathery tannin.

title: Les Useres 2013 L'Alcalatén Tempranillo-Cabernet Sauvignon (Vino de la Tierra de Castelló)
description: Floral, soapy aromas of tomato, cherry and currant are light and lack commitment. This Tempranillo-blend feels rocky despite being light in body, while candied plum, red currant and rose hip flavors hollow out quickly and finish with scratchy tannins.
region_1: Vino de la Tierra de Castelló
